line_1: Which, when the best of actors shall exceed,
line_2: Let it devolve to one of smaller breed.

line_1: Thy noble chace all others does exceed,
line_2: In artful fury, and well-temper'd speed.

line_1: But Carps all Kinds in num'rous Births exceed,
line_2: They still unweary'd with their Labour breed.

line_1: Nor must the Days of formal Tears exceed,
line_2: To cross the Living, and abuse the Dead.

line_1: Always upon th' indulging side exceed;
line_2: But if your temper to extremes should lead,

line_1: Which do's all humane Chastisements exceed;
line_2: Thus stand the LICTORS gazing on a Deed,

line_1: But if he play the glutton and exceed,
line_2: His benefactress blushes at the deed.

line_1: Most mighty Powers! doth not Wine exceed
line_2: In Strength? — It overcometh all indeed:

line_1: He finds the labours of that state exceed
